decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Fire safety statement received 02/05/2024, 2SP/26042024/REV-A received 26/06/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in the flank elevation of the development hereby permitted.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.

Condition : 5 - The detached single storey outbuilding hereby permitted shall only be used for a purpose incidental to the enjoyment of the house at the '22 Spencer Road, Isleworth, TW7 4BH' described at the top of this decision letter and for no other purpose (for example, it may not be used as a self-contained dwelling or contain a bedroom, bathroom, kitchen or other primary residential accommodation, nor may it be used for business purposes). 
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the character of the area.
description: Erection of a detached rear outbuilding.
